title: New tabs from outside of firefox
content:
When I open a new tab it always opens next to the source eg to the right of the tab i am using. Which is great and I prefer this.

But when I click a link from outside firefox to open a web page it always opens on the far right tab. Is there a way to change this so it opens to the right of current tab like normal?
creator: jeremy_strong69

title: Firefox Browser (MAC) 108.0.1 (64 bit) not printing
content: Using Firefox for years on MAC. Since upgrading to 108.0.1 printing no longer works. PDF using either printer icon on page or Apple& P keys, get waiting circle saying "preparing...) running indefinitely, can get out only by escape key. Same page can be instantly downloaded and printed outside Firefox, or printed on Safari. I have rebooted system to no avail. Since problem coincided with update to this update I am treating it as a bug in version. MAC OS is 10.13.6 High Sierra and exhibiting no other issues.
creator: irv3

title: accessing outlook live
content: I don't know if this is a firefox or outlook problem, but I can no longer access outlook live (https://outlook.live.com/mail/0/) from my main screen. Blank page. Oddly enough though, I can access it by going to "private browsing." So I'm guessing there's a setting that's keeping outlook from loading, but I don't remember changing any settings recently, so I'm stumped. This has been happening for only the past 3 days.
creator: denbetsy2

title: web page appears to be hijacked, only in Firefox when in a video, shows multiple header bars and is jittery, affects resolution when out of browser, needs reboot to resolve fuzzy text.
content: web page appears to be hijacked, only in Firefox, shows multiple header bars and is jittery, affects resolution when out of browser, needs reboot to resolve fuzzy text.
